author: anon.
contents:
col. 1 + col. 2 (beginning): end of a glossary to Od. 1 (not mythographic);
col. 2: hypothesis to Od. 2;
col. 2 (end) to col. 4 (beginning): glossary to Od. 2 (not mythographic);
col. 4: hypothesis to Od. 3.Both hypotheseis differ considerably from the manuscript tradition and from the hypp. on P.Ryl. 01, 23 and P.Ant. 02, 69, although they have a comparable structure.
propernames:
col. 2: Êôs (Q); Têlemachos; Ithakêsioi [Ithacans]; Pylos; Lakedaimôn; Ikarios; Athêna;
col. 4: Êelios [Hêlios] (Q); Têlemachos (2); Athêna; Pylos (R); Odysseus; Lakedaimôn; Menelaos.
mythological:
col. 2: Êôs (Q); Têlemachos; Ithakêsioi [Ithacans]; Pylos; Lakedaimôn; Ikarios; Athêna;
col. 4: Êelios [Hêlios] (Q); Têlemachos (2); Athêna; Pylos (R); Odysseus; Lakedaimôn; Menelaos.
statepreservation:
the two papyri belong to the same roll: (B) consists of two fragments, a large one (a) with remains of 4 columns, and a small one (b) with the 4 beginning lines of col. 2; (A) fits neatly into the gap between fr. B, b and a, at the top of col. 2;
col. 1: scanty remains from the endings of a few lines;
col. 2: preserved at full height, with 43 almost complete lines (5 lines glossary + 20 lines hyp. + 18 lines glossary);
col. 3: preserved at full height, with 38 lines (ll. 1-23 = broken off to the right in the middle; ll. 24-38 = complete);
col. 4: beginnings of 19 lines from the bottom of the col. (2 lines glossary + 17 lines hyp.).
lectionalsigns: kind of paragraphos used to separate the glossaries from the hypotheseis, with traces in the margin that could be indications of the books; trema (several); frequent misspellings; some errors in the lemmata; in the glossaries, large blank spaces between lemmata and explanations.
hand: small, informal, mixed round, leaning slightly forward, not bilinear and very irregular, closely spaced, carelessly executed by a fairly practised schoolhand of the "rapid" type, mostly separating the letters.
